pr_title: Integration of WebSockets POC into Helidon 2.0

timeline.message: Initial integration of Tyrus integration POC into 2.0 branch.
Merge branch 'master' into websockets20

Moved new dependencies to parent POM, fixed copyright and checkstyle problems.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Some changes to the webserver engine to handle websocket connections.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed copyright and checkstyle.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

A few more copyright fixes.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Spotbugs fix.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Moving up to WebSockets API 1.1.2.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Created base class for tests. Improved testing for EchoService.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Basic support for WebSocket programmatic API. New and improved testing that includes verification of encoders and decoders.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

New routing tests. Some additional changes to test framework.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Filter out any flush buffers in the count.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Merging with master for PR 1259.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Initial work to support WebSocket in Helidon MP.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Tyrus component provider to integrate with CDI. Changes to JerseySupport to ignore websocket handshakes. MP server test.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>
Support for scanning programmatic endpoints and applications. Allow @ApplicationPath annotation on subclasses of ServerApplicationConfig. Some test changes.
Testing websocket applications and programmatic endpoints.
Extended server builder to allow manually setting a websocket application. Updated corresponding test.
New MP example that uses REST and WebSockets. Some other minor changes.
Fixed copyright problems.

Make @ServerEndpoint annotation a bean-defining annotation in CDI so that scanning discovers endpoints even if not annotated with a CDI scope. This is the same we currently do for @Path in JAX-RS. Simplified example a bit.
New Helidon SE example that uses the WebSocket programmatic API.

Merging with master.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Initial doc for websocket support in Helidon SE and MP.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Fixed copyright.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>
Dropped support @ApplicationPath on websocket classes in favor of @RoutingPath/@RoutingName.
Initial support for executor services in Helidon MP. In MP, websocket endpoint methods are no longer called using Netty threads.
Updated tests to verify threads in which endpoint methods are called.
Updated docs explaining websocket threading model for SE and MP.

timeline.bodyText:
I do not think the .flavor() method is good. We do not control the time when the flavor is configured and this is not the intention (HelidonFeatures task is to list features of Helidon, not to handle the flavor of Helidon).
Also the approach for thread pools is to use one of the existing ThreadPoolSupplier classes, that already handle lazy initiialization.
If you do not need an executor in SE, than why is this method in this class? It should be in the CDI extension for WebSockets, and the TyrusSupport class should only provider features to handle the SE model (with capability to build the MP model on top of it).
timeline.author: tomas-langer
tomas-langer
tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText:
I am not sure I understand this - why do you use an executor service, when you call get on the result? You are blocking the current thread anyways, why not just call the statement directly?
Also this seems to be an issue for our WebServer, as you should never block
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText:
WebSocket support should not be part of Helidon MicroProfile server.
This adds an unwanted dependency on Tyrus for MP implementation.
Please extract WebSocket support into a separate module.
timeline.author: tomas-langer
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -69,6 +71,20 @@ static Server create(Class<? extends Application>... applicationClasses) throws
         return builder.build();
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Create a server instance using a Websocket application class.
+     *
+     * @param applicationClass websocket application class
+     * @return server instance to be started
+     * @throws MpException in case the server fails to be created
+     * @see #builder()
+     */
+    static Server create(Class<? extends ServerApplicationConfig> applicationClass) throws MpException {

timeline.bodyText: Remove from Server. WebSocket should be handled in a separate module.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: Extract into a separate module, use WebSocketCdiExtension in that module to setup everything
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: There should be no dependency on tyrus or websocket in Helidon MP Server.
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText:
Do not use info level, unless it is an information needed for every user on every startup.
This seems to be debug information.
You can list Tyrus applications in info - but only when actually registering them (e.g. by the time we have the complete list).
timeline.author: tomas-langer

replies.bodyText: Yes, these were all misuses of logging for development.
replies.author: spericas

timeline.bodyText: see above - do not use info level
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: see above - do not use info level
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText: see above - do not use info level
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.bodyText:
This looks like a candidate for finest, not fine.
Also when constructing a message in log levels lower than info, please use lambda:
LOGGER.finest(() -> "..."  + msg); to avoid string concatenation on every single byte buffer received
timeline.author: tomas-langer

timeline.message: Minor improvements and fixes to logging calls.
Ensure Netty's thread is not blocked when setting up a connection in MP.

Fixed checkstyle.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>
Re-shuffled code to remove dependency with websockets API and Tyrus in microprofile's server module. Use CDI events between modules for loose coupling.
Dropped support for websockets in Server.Builder. Created subclass for TyrusSupport in MP. Fixed tests.
Fixed spotbugs error.
Removed unused method and updated docs.
Removed unused class.

Renamed module from tyrus to websocket. Restored transitive dependencies in MP server.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>

Renamed module from tyrus to websocket. Restored transitive dependencies in MP server.

Signed-off-by: Santiago Pericas-Geertsen <santiago.pericasgeertsen@oracle.com>
